shared.network

Interface Connection

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    NetworkRmi, NetworkSocket

    public interface Connection
extends java.lang.AutoCloseable

    This interface can be used to abstract the NetworkRmi and NetworkSocket classes, and use them in a transparent way; they both implement the following methods, however you should look at the class' specific documentation to learn the differences on how to call these methods

    See Also:
    AutoCloseable, NetworkSocket, NetworkRmi

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      This method is used to tear down the networking setup of a Connection instance; also, it is called automatically in a try-with-resources block, thanks to this interface extending AutoCloseable
      void export(java.lang.Object o, java.lang.String name)
      Register on the connection's server an Object, binding it to a name; then it will be callable through its reference obtained by getExported(String)
      <T> T getExported(java.lang.String name)
      Obtain a reference to a registered object, which should have been prior exported using export(Object, String); this is a generic method which will convert the returned reference into the destination type, for example:
      DestClass dc = getExported("Foo")
      will try to obtain an exported reference, bound to the name "Foo", and then will try to cast it into the destination type DestClass
      java.lang.Integer getListeningPort()
      Obtain the port on which the Connection instance will accept or send
      java.lang.String getLocalIp()
      Obtain the IPv4 address of the machine on which is being run the instance of Connection you call this method on
      static java.lang.String getLocalIp(java.lang.String iface)
      Obtain local machine address in IPv4 format, by enumerating network interfaces; if no network interface is detected, loopback address is used by default
      java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.String callee, java.lang.String methodName, java.lang.Object[] argList)
      Perform a method call through a network segment, from a Connection instance to another one on a different JVM or on the same one; you can call this method only on objects registered prior on the server through the export(Object, String) method.

    • Method Detail

      • export

        void export(java.lang.Object o,
            java.lang.String name)
        Register on the connection's server an Object, binding it to a name; then it will be callable through its reference obtained by getExported(String)
        Parameters:
        o - object to be exported on the connection's server
        name - text string bound to the exported object; you will access the exported object through its exported name
        See Also:
        NetworkSocket.export(Object, String), NetworkRmi.export(Object, String)

      • getLocalIp

        java.lang.String getLocalIp()
        Obtain the IPv4 address of the machine on which is being run the instance of Connection you call this method on
        Returns:
        IP address version 4, of the machine which is running the JVM with this instance in it

      • getListeningPort

        java.lang.Integer getListeningPort()
        Obtain the port on which the Connection instance will accept or send
        Returns:
        port number used by the Connection instance to exchange data
        See Also:
        NetworkSocket.getListeningPort(), NetworkRmi.getListeningPort()

      • getExported

        <T> T getExported(java.lang.String name)
        Obtain a reference to a registered object, which should have been prior exported using export(Object, String); this is a generic method which will convert the returned reference into the destination type, for example:
        DestClass dc = getExported("Foo")
        will try to obtain an exported reference, bound to the name "Foo", and then will try to cast it into the destination type DestClass
        Type Parameters:
        T - destination type for the obtained reference - which will be an Object by default; a cast will be performed before returning
        Parameters:
        name - text representing the name the object you are looking for was bound to, what export(Object, String) was called on the object you want the reference to
        Returns:
        reference to the exported object, cast to the destination type

      • invokeMethod

        java.lang.Object invokeMethod(java.lang.String callee,
                              java.lang.String methodName,
                              java.lang.Object[] argList)
                       throws MethodConnectionException
        Perform a method call through a network segment, from a Connection instance to another one on a different JVM or on the same one; you can call this method only on objects registered prior on the server through the export(Object, String) method. You must keep a reference to the name used at export-time, to provide it as this method's first parameter
        Parameters:
        callee - name of the exported object you want to call the method on (the text bound to it at export-time)
        methodName - name of the method you want to call, as a String object
        argList - a list of method's arguments; method signatures are position-wise, so you must place the parameter in the correct order
        Returns:
        return value of the invoked method, obtained as an Object
        Throws:
        MethodConnectionException - when connection issues occur between client and server; also an error messag will be printed to tell more about the problem

      • close

        void close()
        This method is used to tear down the networking setup of a Connection instance; also, it is called automatically in a try-with-resources block, thanks to this interface extending AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable

      • getLocalIp

        static java.lang.String getLocalIp(java.lang.String iface)
                            throws java.net.SocketException
        Obtain local machine address in IPv4 format, by enumerating network interfaces; if no network interface is detected, loopback address is used by default
        Parameters:
        iface - string or substring to look for when enumerating interfaces: the interface which name contains iface will have its IPs enumerated
        Returns:
        string representing the first IPv4 address of the found interface; if no interface is found which name matches iface, then "localhost" is returned
        Throws:
        java.net.SocketException - when there are issues in the network interfaces enumeration; should be caught from outside
